clinical_study.brief_title: Topical Formulations of Liposomal Local Anesthetics
clinical_study.official_title: Local Anesthetic Activity of Liposomal Formulations in Dentistry

collaborator.agency: Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo

brief_summary.textblock: This blinded cross-over study aim to evaluate the efficacy of topical liposome-encapsulated ropivacaine formulations.

detailed_description.textblock: This blinded cross-over study aim to evaluate the efficacy of topical liposome-encapsulated 1 and 2% ropivacaine gel formulations.

primary_outcome.measure: After topical application of the local anesthetic formulations at the oral mucosa, their influence on pulpal response was assessed by an electrical pulp tester.

secondary_outcome.measure: The efficacy of the topical anesthetics was measured after a simulation of a local anesthesia in the application site (insertion of a 30 gauge needle until periosteum contact).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 seconds after removal of topical formulation

arm_group.description: The topical anesthetics were applied at the region of right and left maxillary lateral incisors at the buccal mucosa.

Topical formulations were applied at the palatal mucosa at the right canine region and efficacy of topical formulations was accessed through insertion of a 30 gauge needle and injection of anesthetic solution.

intervention.description: 100 mg of the following formulations: Liposome-encapsulated 1 and 2% ropivacaine gel, liposome placebo gel and 2.5% lidocaine and 2.5% prilocaine cream were applied once during 5 minutes.
intervention.other_name: Topical anesthesia in the palatal mucosa

intervention.description: 100 mg of the following formulations: Liposome-encapsulated 1 and 2% ropivacaine gel, liposome placebo gel and 20% benzocaine gel were applied once during 30 minutes.
intervention.other_name: Topical anesthesia in the buccal mucosa.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Volunteers were free from cardiac, hepatic, renal, pulmonary, neurological, gastrointestinal and haematological diseases, psychiatric disorders and allergy to local anesthetics
